alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mecklenburg, eastern Gaston and northeastern York Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Uptown Charlotte, or near Steele Creek, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Central Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Mint Hill and Mt Holly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
